What is Verus, and what are its main features?

Verus is an open-source, decentralized blockchain protocol that uses both proof-of-work and proof-of-stake as its consensus mechanism. It offers rent-free blockchain tools for creators and organizations to build products, services, and systems. Verus is a multichain protocol that focuses on scalability, security, and decentralization, and can scale to meet global demand. It is also 51% hash attack resistant and community-built, with all coins in circulation being fairly mined and staked.

# Introduction to VerusWelcome to the Verus documentation. Here you find all mainnet and testnet protocol features and implementations. The documentation will be updated continuously.## Open-source, rent-free, scalable public infrastructure
Verus is an open-source, [fairly launched](/overview/#fair-launch), decentralized blockchain protocol with proof-of-work and proof-of-stake as its consensus mechanism. It offers rent-free blockchain tools for creators and organizations to build products, services and systems.Verus is a multichain protocol with strong focus on scalability, security and decentralization. It can scale to world demand, is proven 51% hash attack resistant and is community built - all coins in circulation are fairly mined and staked.With Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) anyone can launch scalable, fully interoperable, customizable and independent blockchains for public or private use. Launch tokens & basket currencies (e.g. liquidity pools) on top of blockchains for any use case. Get funding and create markets with protocol level built-in DeFi and smart launch options.Protocol-level self-sovereign digital identities and namespaces ([VerusID](/verusid/)) are at the center of the Verus multichain protocol. Giving builders, communities, businesses and organizations tools never before seen.Everything happening on the Verus multichain protocol has aligned incentives with the [miners and stakers](/economy/) of the worldwide network. This makes it one of the most secure protocols with opportunities to earn.## Low-cost, rapid & easy deployment
Launch blockchains, tokens, liquidity pools, identities and much more without any coding needed, just simple API commands. Save money on expensive blockchain (Solidity) developers & infrastructure with the rent-free Verus Protocol.
./raw_text_input_docs/README_overview.md
What is Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS), and how does it relate to Verus?

Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) is a feature of the Verus protocol that allows anyone to launch scalable, fully interoperable, customizable, and independent blockchains for public or private use. This enables the creation of tokens, basket currencies, and liquidity pools on top of these blockchains for various use cases. PBaaS also provides protocol-level built-in DeFi and smart launch options.

What is the significance of VerusID in the Verus multichain protocol?

VerusID is a protocol-level self-sovereign digital identity and namespace that is at the center of the Verus multichain protocol. It provides builders, communities, businesses, and organizations with tools that have never been seen before, enabling them to create and manage their own digital identities and namespaces.

What is the benefit of using the Verus protocol for deploying blockchains and tokens?

The Verus protocol allows for low-cost, rapid, and easy deployment of blockchains, tokens, liquidity pools, identities, and more, without requiring coding knowledge. This is achieved through simple API commands, which saves money on expensive blockchain developers and infrastructure.
